snippet: Local governments in New York are finding themselves in the middle of a financial crisis, with problems spreading as they face a toxic mix of soaring pension and retiree health costs.
abstract: Local governments in New York State are finding themselves in the middle of a financial crisis, with problems spreading as they face a toxic mix of stresses including soaring pension and retiree health costs; Suffolk County has projected a $530 million deficit over a three-year period, declaring a financial emergency; municipalities, having exhausted one-time cuts and maneuvers, may face steep budget tradeoffs and even the loss of control to outside oversight boards.
lead_paragraph: Local governments in New York are finding themselves in the middle of a financial crisis, with problems spreading as they face a toxic mix of soaring pension and retiree health costs.

headline.main: Deficits Push N.Y. Cities and Counties to Desperation
headline.print_headline: Amid Gains, Municipalities In Dire Straits
